homeFaq.question: What forest management services are offered?
homeFaq.answer: We offer a full forest management cycle: forest inventory, management plan development, young stand tending, forest planting, sanitary felling, as well as consultations on sustainable forest management.

homeFaq.question: Do you offer timber purchasing?
homeFaq.answer: Yes, we purchase timber directly from forest owners. We ensure competitive prices, professional assessment, and fast payment. We work with various timber species — pine, spruce, birch, and other tree species.

homeFaq.question: How does forest inventory work?
homeFaq.answer: Forest inventory includes a detailed account and evaluation of forest resources. Our specialists use modern technologies and methods to determine tree species composition, age, growth volumes, and forest health status. After the inventory, you will receive a detailed report with recommendations.

homeFaq.question: What are the forest restoration options after harvesting?
homeFaq.answer: We offer several forest restoration methods: natural regeneration, artificial forest restoration by planting or seeding. We help choose the most suitable tree species for specific growing conditions and provide quality planting material.

homeFaq.question: Do you provide consultations on EU and state support programs?
homeFaq.answer: Yes, our specialists provide consultations on available EU funds and state support programs for forest owners. We help prepare the necessary documentation and applications, and advise on the conditions for receiving support.

homeFaq.question: How is the timber price determined?
homeFaq.answer: Timber price is determined taking into account several factors: tree species, quality, assortment structure, forwarding distance, and market situation. For each object, we perform an individual assessment and offer the best possible price.

perkamMezuFaq.question: What is the forest property price per hectare in Latvia in 2024?
perkamMezuFaq.answer: Forest property prices in Latvia in 2024 range from 2,000 to 8,000 EUR per hectare depending on tree species, age, quality, and location. Pine and spruce stands with good accessibility and 40-80 years of age reach the highest prices. AM Forest offers free professional assessment to determine the exact market value of your forest property.

perkamMezuFaq.question: How to sell a forest property in Latvia — step by step?
perkamMezuFaq.answer: Forest property selling process: 1) Contact AM Forest for a free consultation, 2) Our experts perform a professional forest inventory and assessment, 3) Receive a fair price offer within 48 hours, 4) We process all documents at the notary, 5) Money is transferred immediately after the transaction. On average, the process takes 7-14 days.

perkamMezuFaq.question: Is it more profitable to sell forest with a timber stand or after harvesting?
perkamMezuFaq.answer: AM Forest buys forest properties in all conditions — both with ready timber stands and after harvesting. Unharvested forest with mature stands (60-80 years) is often more valuable as the buyer has more freedom of choice. Harvested properties with young stands (5-20 years) are also in demand for long-term investments. We ensure a competitive price regardless of forest condition.

perkamMezuFaq.question: What documents are needed for selling a forest property?
perkamMezuFaq.answer: For forest sale you need: land register certificate, forest inventory data (not older than 10 years), personal identification document, and tax payment confirmation. AM Forest helps arrange missing documents, performs new inventory at no cost, and provides legal support throughout the transaction process, including communication with the State Forest Service.

perkamCirsmuFaq.question: What is the timber stand price per cubic meter in Latvia in 2024?
perkamCirsmuFaq.answer: Timber stand prices in Latvia in 2024 range from 35 to 85 EUR per cubic meter depending on tree species, quality, diameter, and accessibility. Pine and spruce stands with large-diameter trees and good accessibility reach the highest prices. AM Forest offers free professional assessment to determine the exact market value of your timber stand.

perkamCirsmuFaq.question: How to sell a timber stand in Latvia — step by step?
perkamCirsmuFaq.answer: Timber stand selling process: 1) Contact AM Forest for a free consultation, 2) Our experts perform a professional stand measurement and assessment, 3) Receive a fair price offer within 24 hours, 4) We process the timber stand purchase agreement, 5) Money is transferred immediately after signing. On average, the process takes 3-7 days.

perkamCirsmuFaq.question: Is it more profitable to sell a standing timber stand or harvested timber?
perkamCirsmuFaq.answer: AM Forest buys timber stands in all forms — both standing and already harvested timber. Standing timber is more convenient for the forest owner as all work is done by the buyer. Harvested timber can yield higher profit but requires additional investment and risk. We ensure a competitive price in both cases and can help choose the most profitable option.

perkamCirsmuFaq.question: What factors affect the timber stand value?
perkamCirsmuFaq.answer: Main factors: tree species (pine, spruce, birch), tree diameter and height, timber quality (straightness, number of branches), accessibility (road quality, distance), stand size and concentration. AM Forest experts evaluate all these factors to offer the most favorable price for your timber stand.

hero.title: Why Should You Maintain Your Forest?
hero.subtitle: Forest maintenance is one of the most important tasks that directly affects the value and resilience of the forest in the future.

forestMaintenance.intro: A timely maintained forest grows higher quality, healthier, and more resistant to damage caused by wind, snow, and other natural factors. By caring for a young forest from its first years of growth, a strong and productive stand is created with greater economic potential for the future.

agrotechnical.heading: Agrotechnical Maintenance
agrotechnical.p1: In the first years after forest regeneration, it is important to ensure that young trees are not suppressed by grass, bushes, and unwanted shoots. During agrotechnical maintenance, growing space around target tree species is cleared, allowing them to grow stronger and straighter.
agrotechnical.p2: These works are usually performed for several years after planting or natural regeneration, depending on how intensively the area becomes overgrown. Regular maintenance helps reduce the number of damaged trees and promotes uniform stand development.
agrotechnical.p3: AM Forest provides professional agrotechnical maintenance, evaluating the conditions of each area and adjusting work intensity to the specific situation.

youngStands.heading: Young Stand Maintenance
youngStands.p1: When the forest has already grown, the next important step is young stand maintenance. Its goal is to create a quality, healthy, and productive stand with an appropriate tree species composition and optimal number of trees per hectare.
youngStands.p2: A timely maintained young stand grows faster, trees become thicker and more resilient, and in the future, it is possible to obtain higher-value timber. During maintenance, competing, damaged, or low-value trees are removed, giving preference to the strongest and most promising trees. Such work helps create a forest with greater economic value for future harvesting.
youngStands.p3: AM Forest performs young stand maintenance according to the specific forest's age, composition, and growing conditions, ensuring a healthy, resilient, and valuable forest in the long term.

benefits.heading: What Does Forest Maintenance Give the Owner?
items: Faster and higher quality tree growth.
More valuable and productive stand in the future.
Lower risk of wind, snow, and disease damage.
Greater financial return from future harvests.
benefits.outro: AM Forest helps forest owners take care of their forest at all stages of its development, providing professional and thoughtful forest maintenance.

cta.description: Our experts will help evaluate your forest condition and offer the most suitable maintenance solutions.

meta.title: How to Sell a Forest? | AM Forest
meta.description: Learn how to properly sell a forest property. AM Forest helps with forest valuation and the selling process.

hero.title: How to Sell a Forest?
hero.subtitle: Selling a forest is a significant decision for many owners, as such a transaction often happens only once in a lifetime.

sellForest.intro: Selling a forest differs from regular real estate sales because it is not just a land transaction. The forest value is significantly affected by the timber growing in it, access to the property, and the market situation at the given moment. Therefore, it is important to make a thoughtful decision and cooperate with an experienced industry partner.

whenToSell.heading: When to Consider Selling a Forest?
whenToSell.p1: A forest can be sold at various stages of its development, and the reasons for such a decision can be very different. The owner does not always want or can wait for the moment when the stand reaches maximum value.
whenToSell.p2: Often the decision is determined by practical considerations — funds are needed, the property is far from the place of residence, or its management has become a heavy burden. The most important thing is to objectively evaluate both the forest condition and your situation.

priceFactors.heading: What Determines Forest Price?
priceFactors.intro: Forest price is affected by several important factors:
items: Tree species, age, and timber volume.
Access to the property and harvesting conditions.
priceFactors.outro: Even a seemingly insignificant forest area can turn out to be a valuable property.

waysToSell.heading: How Can You Sell a Forest?
waysToSell.p1: A forest can be sold in various ways — as a felling area, standing trees, or the entire forest property together with the land. Each of these options has its nuances, and the most suitable choice depends on the owner's goals and future plans.

meta.description: Learn how to determine the best time for forest harvesting. AM Forest helps evaluate stand readiness.

hero.title: When Is the Right Time to Harvest?
hero.subtitle: The right moment for harvesting is not a specific date on the calendar. It is determined by the stand age, condition, and your goals as an owner.

whenToHarvest.intro: Choosing the right time helps obtain greater value and protect the forest from losses.

factors.title: Tree Age and Harvesting Age
factors.description: Each tree species has a specific age when the stand reaches harvesting maturity. If the forest is overmature, the risk of damage increases and timber quality may deteriorate. On the other hand, a timely maintained forest often achieves better quality and greater value at the time of harvesting.

factors.title: Stand Health
factors.description: Wind and snow damage, as well as pest damage or diseases, can be a signal to act in time to preserve timber quality and its value.

factors.title: Market Situation
factors.description: Timber prices fluctuate. A favorable market situation can be an additional argument for harvesting, especially if the stand has already reached harvesting age.

factors.title: Previous Investments in Forest Maintenance
factors.description: Timely maintenance, young stand thinning, and other forestry work affect how quality and valuable the forest grows. A maintained forest more often provides greater financial return at the time of harvesting.

factors.title: Owner's Plans
factors.description: Sometimes the decision is determined by practical reasons. Funds may be needed, there is no time for management, or the property is far from the place of residence.

whenToHarvest.conclusion: AM Forest evaluates your stand's age, composition, health, and maintenance history, as well as the market situation. Choosing the right time for harvesting is one of the most important decisions for increasing forest value.

meta.title: What to Know Before Logging? | AM Forest
meta.description: Essential information before forest logging. Documents, restrictions, and work organization.

hero.title: What to Know Before Logging?
hero.subtitle: Forest logging is a responsible step. For the work to proceed legally, safely, and profitably, several important aspects must be evaluated beforehand.

beforeLogging.intro: Before starting forest logging, it is essential to ensure that all necessary conditions are met and documentation is in order.

factors.title: Is the Stand Ready for Harvesting
factors.description: It is important to understand whether the stand has reached harvesting age and whether its quality will yield valuable timber. A prematurely harvested forest can mean lost potential value.

factors.title: Required Documents
factors.description: A felling certificate is required for harvesting. Logging cannot be performed without it. Property rights must also be in order and current forest inventory data must be available.

factors.title: Logging Conditions
factors.description: Access to the property, road condition, and soil bearing capacity are of great importance. In some cases, work can only be done in certain seasons to avoid damaging the soil and preserve the forest environment.

factors.title: Restrictions and Protected Areas
factors.description: It must be verified whether there are nature protection restrictions on the property that may affect the scope or timing of harvesting.

factors.title: Forest Regeneration Obligation
factors.description: After harvesting, the owner has an obligation to regenerate the forest within a specified period. This means planning planting or natural regeneration before starting the harvesting.

factors.title: Work Organization
factors.description: It is important to choose a reliable contractor who works responsibly and follows both legislation and economic logic. Improperly performed harvesting can cause losses to both the forest and the owner.

beforeLogging.conclusion: AM Forest evaluates all essential factors before forest logging – stand age, condition, access options, documentation, and market situation. We ensure that harvesting is performed at the appropriate time and manner so that the owner receives maximum return from their forest. We arrange the necessary documents, organize harvesting work, and ensure quality forest regeneration after harvesting.
